items.title: "It is not just the effects of a virus, but the fallout of...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"It is not just the effects of a virus, but the fallout of longstanding disparities in access to reliable, affordable healthcare. “How do we provide healthcare for all? Healthcare is a right, not a privilege“ On this, Gov. Jared Polis established the COVID-19 Health Equity Response Team to ensure racial and ethnicity COVID-19 data are “accessible, transparent and used in decision-making”
Colorado Public Radio

Black and Latino residents are getting sick and dying from COVID-19 at higher rates in Colorado and nationally. Community health centers are trying to help.

cpr.org

The Coronavirus Exposed Colorado's Racial Inequities in Health Care

Black and Latino residents are getting sick and dying from COVID-19 at higher rates in Colorado and nationally. Community health centers are trying to help.Black and Latino residents are getting sick and dying from COVID-19 at higher rates in Colorado and nationally. Community health centers are trying to help.

items.title: "In many ways, this show is an extension of my work to...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"In many ways, this show is an extension of my work to support children’s health as First Lady—and to be quite honest, I wish a program like this had been around when my girls were young,"
9NEWS (KUSA)

The new show, called "Waffles + Mochi," launches March 16 and will be "all about good food: discovering it, cooking it, and of course, eating it."

9news.com

Michelle Obama announces new Netflix children's food show

The new show, called "Waffles + Mochi," launches March 16 and will be "all about good food: discovering it, cooking it, and of course, eating it."The new show, called "Waffles + Mochi," launches March 16 and will be "all about good food: discovering it, cooking it, and of course, eating it."

items.title: "Isabella Hageman never had a Black teacher — someone who...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Isabella Hageman never had a Black teacher — someone who looked like her — in her entire K-12 schooling in South Dakota. The 19-year-old college freshman wants to change that reality for Black students in Colorado where most teachers are disproportionately white compared to their students."
The Denver Post

Isabella Hageman never had a Black teacher — someone who looked like her — in her entire K-12 schooling in South Dakota. The 19-year-old college freshman wants to change that reality fo…

denverpost.com

To retain more Black teachers, new Colorado higher ed program supplements their salary up to $20K

Isabella Hageman never had a Black teacher — someone who looked like her — in her entire K-12 schooling in South Dakota. items.title: "Democrats in Congress must fully embrace their mandate to...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Democrats in Congress must fully embrace their mandate to fast-track democracy reforms that give voters a fair fight, rather than allowing undemocratic systems to be used as tools and excuses to perpetuate that same system. This is a moment of both historic imperative and, with unified Democratic control of the White House and Congress, historic opportunity."
Washington Post

The challenge now is what we do to keep that from happening again.

washingtonpost.com

Opinion | Stacey Abrams: Our democracy faced a near-death experience. Here’s how to revive it.

The challenge now is what we do to keep that from happening again.The challenge now is what we do to keep that from happening again.

items.title: "The pantry is jam-packed with donated food, everything...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"The pantry is jam-packed with donated food, everything from canned goods to breakfast cereal to pasta and veggies.
Manager Dwight Thompson said for many musicians in town, surviving the pandemic has come down to paying for food or paying for rent. The pantry allows them to get enough food to save money for other expenses."
9NEWS (KUSA)

Along with virtual shows, Dazzle Denver is helping out local musicians through a food pantry.

9news.com

Dazzle jazz club creates food bank for musicians

Along with virtual shows, Dazzle Denver is helping out local musicians through a food pantry.Along with virtual shows, Dazzle Denver is helping out local musicians through a food pantry.

items.title: "Denver’s population boom brings with it rising rent and...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Denver’s population boom brings with it rising rent and housing costs, and residents adding roommates or renting out a room to cut costs can quickly run afoul of the law.
Among major American cities, Denver stands alone when it comes to how many unrelated people can live in the same home: two."
The Denver Post

High housing costs and a competitive market have even Denver city officials scrambling to find solutions for those priced out, and their dual-pronged proposal that’s up for a public hearing and fin…

denverpost.com

Denver poised to raise group living limit, but some worry move will damage neighborhoods

High housing costs and a competitive market have even Denver city officials scrambling to find solutions for those priced out, and their dual-pronged proposal that’s up for a public hearing and fin…High housing costs and a competitive market have even Denver city officials scrambling to find solutions for those priced out, and their dual-pronged proposal that’s up for a public hearing and fin…

items.title: "Carroll Foy is the first black woman to run for statewide...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Carroll Foy is the first black woman to run for statewide office in Virginia, and if elected, she would be the first black woman governor in the country. "
ELLE Magazine (US)

She spoke exclusively to ELLE.com before announcing her campaign about the "left behind" community where she grew up, Ruth Bader Ginsburg, and the historic fight ahead.

elle.com

Jennifer Carroll Foy Wants to Be the First Black Woman Governor in America

She spoke exclusively to ELLE.com before announcing her campaign about the "left behind" community where she grew up, Ruth Bader Ginsburg, and the historic fight ahead.She spoke exclusively to ELLE.com before announcing her campaign about the "left behind" community where she grew up, Ruth Bader Ginsburg, and the historic fight ahead.

items.title: "By signing the order, Biden reverted to procedures first...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"By signing the order, Biden reverted to procedures first put in place under the Obama administration allowing transgender service members to serve openly once again, and prohibiting “involuntary separations, discharges and denials of re-enlistment… on the basis of gender identity”.
PinkNews

The Pentagon confirmed that trans people can "walk in and join" the military today, amid concerns about when Trump's ban would officially end.

pinknews.co.uk

The Pentagon wants trans people to know they can ‘walk in and join’ the military today

The Pentagon confirmed that trans people can "walk in and join" the military today, amid concerns about when Trump's ban would officially end.The Pentagon confirmed that trans people can "walk in and join" the military today, amid concerns about when Trump's ban would officially end.

items.title: “Over the first six months of the pilot, Denver received more...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

“Over the first six months of the pilot, Denver received more than 2,500 emergency calls that fell into the STAR program's purview, and the STAR team was able to respond to 748 calls. No calls required the assistance of police, and no one was arrested.”

USA TODAY

The STAR program was able to respond to 748 calls in 6 months. No calls required the assistance of police, and no one was arrested.

usatoday.com

Denver successfully sent mental health professionals, not police, to hundreds of calls

The STAR program was able to respond to 748 calls in 6 months. No calls required the assistance of police, and no one was arrested.The STAR program was able to respond to 748 calls in 6 months. No calls required the assistance of police, and no one was arrested.

items.title: “In the wake of Black Lives Matter protests this summer, we...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

“In the wake of Black Lives Matter protests this summer, we made a significant cut to policing dollars and reinvested that in things like this,” said Council Member Gregorio Casar, who led the effort to cut police funding and sponsored an amendment last August that set aside $6.5 million in recurring funding to be used for permanent supportive housing and services."
The Appeal

The City Council voted to buy one hotel and use funds diverted from its police budget to set up wraparound services for the homeless people who will live there.

theappeal.org

Austin Will Use Money Cut From Police Budget To Establish Supportive Housing

The City Council voted to buy one hotel and use funds diverted from its police budget to set up wraparound services for the homeless people who will live there.The City Council voted to buy one hotel and use funds diverted from its police budget to set up wraparound services for the homeless people who will live there.

items.title: "The Senate early Friday approved a budget resolution...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"The Senate early Friday approved a budget resolution that’s a key step toward fast-track passage of President Joe Biden’s $1.9 trillion coronavirus relief plan without support from Republicans. Vice President Kamala Harris was in the chair to cast the tie-breaking vote, her first."
The Denver Post

The Senate early Friday approved a budget resolution that’s a key step toward fast-track passage of President Joe Biden’s $1.9 trillion coronavirus relief plan without support from Repu…

denverpost.com

Senate approves budget bill as Harris casts tie-breaker vote

The Senate early Friday approved a budget resolution that’s a key step toward fast-track passage of President Joe Biden’s $1.9 trillion coronavirus relief plan without support from Repu…The Senate early Friday approved a budget resolution that’s a key step toward fast-track passage of President Joe Biden’s $1.9 trillion coronavirus relief plan without support from Repu…

items.title: "A new national poll by Data for Progress and The Lab, a...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"A new national poll by Data for Progress and The Lab, a policy vertical of The Appeal, shows that voters nationwide support releasing people from jails and prisons as a means of containing the spread of COVID-19 and protecting public health. "
The Appeal

Detaining people who pose no danger to the public in crowded, unsanitary jails and prisons not only endangers those who are incarcerated, it also subjects staff and the broader community to needless risk as new, more virulent strains of COVID-19 make their way into the United States.

theappeal.org

As Pandemic Rages, Voters Support Releasing People From Jails And Prisons

Detaining people who pose no danger to the public in crowded, unsanitary jails and prisons not only endangers those who are incarcerated, it also subjects staff and the broader community to needless risk as new, more virulent strains of COVID-19 make their way into the United States.Detaining people who pose no danger to the public in crowded, unsanitary jails and prisons not only endangers those who are incarcerated, it also subjects staff and the broader community to needless risk as new, more virulent strains of COVID-19 make their way into the United States.

items.title: "It’s the latest in a series of pro-LGBT+ orders from the...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"It’s the latest in a series of pro-LGBT+ orders from the Biden administration, including repealing the ban on trans people in the military and implementing the Supreme Court’s Bostock ruling against discrimination."
PinkNews

Joe Biden continues to erase Trump's hateful legacy as he signs a historic memo calling for the global protection of LGBT+ rights

pinknews.co.uk

Biden signs historic memorandum calling for worldwide protection of LGBT+ rights

items.title: Colorado students have seen their school years and lives upended...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

Colorado students have seen their school years and lives upended by this pandemic.[...] We know this is having an impact, and we can’t let our students fall further behind. Protecting critical funding for our school districts is and will continue to be, a top priority for the JBC.
EIN Presswire

einnews.com

JOINT RELEASE: Democratic Budget Committee Members Pledge to Fight for K-12 Education Funding

items.title: "Coming out is often a significant part of reclaiming the...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Coming out is often a significant part of reclaiming the right of living genuinely. It can be a complex process to navigate at the intersections of LGBTQ and Black identities. HRC’s “Coming Out: Living Authentically as Black LGBTQ People” aims to recognize and celebrate these unique experiences."
Human Rights Campaign

Coming out is a personal choice and the lifelong coming out experience is different for everyone.

hrc.org

Coming Out: Living Authentically as Black LGBTQ People

Coming out is a personal choice and the lifelong coming out experience is different for everyone.Coming out is a personal choice and the lifelong coming out experience is different for everyone.

items.title: “The Five Star Program allows certified businesses to host...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

“The Five Star Program allows certified businesses to host customers at a less-restrictive level than their county’s COVID-19 metrics would indicate. Denver is at “level orange” on the state’s dial framework, with most businesses limited to 25% of capacity. Under the program, those that complete the certification process can operate at 50% of capacity.”

The Denver Post

The state health department approved Denver’s application to allow businesses that follow extra COVID-19 precautions to host more customers, but you won’t see a change immediately.

denverpost.com

Denver approved for program allowing businesses to host more customers with COVID-19 precautions

The state health department approved Denver’s application to allow businesses that follow extra COVID-19 precautions to host more customers, but you won’t see a change immediately.The state health department approved Denver’s application to allow businesses that follow extra COVID-19 precautions to host more customers, but you won’t see a change immediately.

items.title: "Throughout 2020, advocates across the country called for...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Throughout 2020, advocates across the country called for sweeping changes on criminal justice reform.

Colorado eliminated qualified immunity, which often shields police officers from civil lawsuits in state courts. Additionally, Colorado’s Law restricts the standards for use of deadly force and mandates police departments to disclose more data."
The Appeal

This year of crises, revisited: Nearly 90 state-level bills and initiatives. 16 themes. 7 maps.

theappeal.org

How States Transformed Criminal Justice in 2020, and How They Fell Short

This year of crises, revisited: Nearly 90 state-level bills and initiatives. 16 themes. 7 maps.This year of crises, revisited: Nearly 90 state-level bills and initiatives. 16 themes. 7 maps.

items.title: "Advocates for the Hispanic community hope the documentary...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Advocates for the Hispanic community hope the documentary also inspires people to support these struggling families. Aragon-Mitotes says nonprofits such as ISAAC of Northern Colorado, The Latino Foundation, and Mujeres de Colores all help support families who are facing hardships during the pandemic."
9NEWS (KUSA)

Fort Collins filmmakers interviewed 14 people and families about their struggles with COVID; advocates for the Hispanic community hope film inspires change.

9news.com

Documentary highlights how hard COVID-19 hit Fort Collins' Hispanic communities

Fort Collins filmmakers interviewed 14 people and families about their struggles with COVID; advocates for the Hispanic community hope film inspires change.Fort Collins filmmakers interviewed 14 people and families about their struggles with COVID; advocates for the Hispanic community hope film inspires change.

items.title: Incredibly humbled by this feature in 5280 and honored to have...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

Incredibly humbled by this feature in 5280 and honored to have community support for this work. We all have a story to tell. Our stories are our strength and our voices will be heard.

"Forget political stereotypes: This history-making legislator is unapologetically progressive, is insistent that state government can be bipartisan (even now), and wants to transform the criminal justice system. And that's just the start of her ambitions.”

- 5280 Magazine
